alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 8:15AM CDT until July 10 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Harrah affecting Oklahoma, Lincoln and Pottawatomie Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Harrah. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Shallow flooding of low-lying areas along the river occurs in eastern Oklahoma County... the southwest corner of Lincoln County... and northwestern Pottawatomie County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 5.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 10.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will rise to 10.9 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM CDT.
